content:
ScriptManagerDesigner Class

In this Article

Provides design-time support for the ScriptManager control in a visual designer.

Syntax

Declaration

public class ScriptManagerDesigner : System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • ComponentDesigner
  • HtmlControlDesigner
  • System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner
  • ScriptManagerDesigner

Remarks

For more information, see the ControlDesigner class documentation.

Constructors summary

ScriptManagerDesigner()

Initializes a new instance of the ScriptManagerDesigner class.

Methods summary

GetApplicationServices(ScriptManager,IEnumerable<ScriptManagerProxy>)

Returns ECMAScript (JavaScript) code that represents the profile service properties defined in a Web page's ScriptManager control and ScriptManagerProxy controls.
GetDesignTimeHtml()

Returns the HTML markup that represents the ScriptManager control at design time.
GetProxyScript(ScriptManager,ServiceReference)

Provides a proxy script from a derived ServiceReference object.
GetProxyUrl(ScriptManager,ServiceReference)

Provides a proxy URL from a derived ServiceReference object.
GetScriptFromWebResource(Assembly,String,CultureInfo)

Returns ECMAScript (JavaScript) code that is defined by the ScriptResourceAttribute attribute.
GetScriptReferences(ScriptManager,IEnumerable<ScriptManagerProxy>)

Returns a collection of all ScriptReference controls that are defined in a Web page's ScriptManager control and ScriptManagerProxy controls.
GetServiceReferences(ScriptManager,IEnumerable<ScriptManagerProxy>)

Returns a collection of all ServiceReference controls that are defined in a Web page's ScriptManager control and ScriptManagerProxy controls.
Initialize(IComponent)

Initializes the specified component.

Constructors

  • ScriptManagerDesigner()

    Initializes a new instance of the ScriptManagerDesigner class.

    public ScriptManagerDesigner ();

    Remarks

    The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the ScriptManagerDesigner class when it creates the associated ScriptManager control or a copy of that control on the design surface.

Methods

  • GetApplicationServices(ScriptManager,IEnumerable<ScriptManagerProxy>)

    Returns ECMAScript (JavaScript) code that represents the profile service properties defined in a Web page's ScriptManager control and ScriptManagerProxy controls.

    public static string GetApplicationServices (System.Web.UI.ScriptManager scriptManager, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy> proxies);

    Parameters

    • scriptManager
      ScriptManager

      The ScriptManager control associated with the Web Page.

    • proxies
      IEnumerable<ScriptManagerProxy>

      The collection of ScriptManagerProxy controls associated with the Web page.

    Returns

    • String

      The JavaScript code that defines the profile service properties.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      scriptManager is null.

  • GetDesignTimeHtml()

    Returns the HTML markup that represents the ScriptManager control at design time.

    public override string GetDesignTimeHtml ();

    Returns

    • String

      The markup that is used to render the ScriptManager at design time.

    Remarks

    Override this method to change the generated HTML of the ScriptManager control at design time.

  • GetProxyScript(ScriptManager,ServiceReference)

    Provides a proxy script from a derived ServiceReference object.

    public static string GetProxyScript (System.Web.UI.ScriptManager scriptManager, System.Web.UI.ServiceReference serviceReference);

    Parameters

    • scriptManager
      ScriptManager

      The ScriptManager control on the page.

    • serviceReference
      ServiceReference

      The ServiceReference control that is used to register a Web service for use in the page.

    Returns

    • String

      The proxy script.

  • GetProxyUrl(ScriptManager,ServiceReference)

    Provides a proxy URL from a derived ServiceReference object.

    public static string GetProxyUrl (System.Web.UI.ScriptManager scriptManager, System.Web.UI.ServiceReference serviceReference);

    Parameters

    • scriptManager
      ScriptManager

      The ScriptManager control on the page.

    • serviceReference
      ServiceReference

      The ServiceReference control that is used to register a Web service for use in the page.

    Returns

    • String

      A proxy URL.

  • GetScriptFromWebResource(Assembly,String,CultureInfo)

    Returns ECMAScript (JavaScript) code that is defined by the ScriptResourceAttribute attribute.

    public static string GetScriptFromWebResource (System.Reflection.Assembly assembly, string resourceName, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture);

    Parameters

    • assembly
      Assembly

      The assembly that contains the resource.

    • resourceName
      String

      The fully qualified name of the resource in the assembly.

    • culture
      CultureInfo

      The culture that the resource is specified for.

    Returns

    • String

      The JavaScript resource.

  • GetScriptReferences(ScriptManager,IEnumerable<ScriptManagerProxy>)

    Returns a collection of all ScriptReference controls that are defined in a Web page's ScriptManager control and ScriptManagerProxy controls.

    public static System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<System.Web.UI.ScriptReference> GetScriptReferences (System.Web.UI.ScriptManager scriptManager, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy> proxies);

    Parameters

    • scriptManager
      ScriptManager

      The ScriptManager control that is associated with the Web page.

    • proxies
      IEnumerable<ScriptManagerProxy>

      The collection of ScriptManagerProxy controls associated with the Web page.

    Returns

    • ReadOnlyCollection<ScriptReference>

      A read-only collection of ScriptReference controls.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      scriptManager is null.

    Remarks

    The collection that is returned includes framework scripts that are sent automatically to the client to support AJAX functionality such as the ScriptManager and UpdatePanel control.

    When you use the GetScriptReferences method, be aware of the following guidelines:

    • Script references with the same Name and Assembly properties are removed as duplicates.

    • Script references with the same <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptReference.Path%2A> are not removed as duplicates at design time. However, they are removed as duplicates at run time.

    • The ResolveClientUrl method is used to return a fully qualified URL for the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptReference.Path%2A> property of script references.

    • The script references in the returned collection are cloned versions of the original script references and therefore cannot be modified in designer code by using this collection.

  • GetServiceReferences(ScriptManager,IEnumerable<ScriptManagerProxy>)

    Returns a collection of all ServiceReference controls that are defined in a Web page's ScriptManager control and ScriptManagerProxy controls.

    public static System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<System.Web.UI.ServiceReference> GetServiceReferences (System.Web.UI.ScriptManager scriptManager, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy> proxies);

    Parameters

    • scriptManager
      ScriptManager

      The ScriptManager control that is associated with the Web page.

    • proxies
      IEnumerable<ScriptManagerProxy>

      The collection of ScriptManagerProxy controls that is associated with the Web page.

    Returns

    • ReadOnlyCollection<ServiceReference>

      A read-only collection of ServiceReference controls.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      scriptManager is null.

  • Initialize(IComponent)

    Initializes the specified component.

    public override void Initialize (System.ComponentModel.IComponent component);

    Parameters

    • component
      IComponent

      A ScriptManager component that implements the IComponent interface.
